                                                                        Hex-Dump Conversion

Tobacco Update -- This week Secretary Shalala and I held several productive outreach
meetings. Tuesday we met with industry lawyers and gained a better understanding of their
position. Wednesday we hosted Farm Bureau representatives from tobacco states, accompanied
by Governor Hunt. The growers urged us to maintain the current tobacco quota and price
support program; require industry to use mostly U.S.-grown tobacco; and provide transition
assistance as the demand for cigarettes falls. Thursday the Vice President hosted former tobacco
industry scientists turned whistleblowers who shared their knowledge with us of the industry's
research into nicotine and "reduced risk" cigarettes. Finally, we also met this week with the
Senate Democratic tobacco task force, chaired by Senator Conrad.

Next week we expect to brief the House Democratic tobacco task force, begin meetings with key
committee chairmen, and wrap up our meetings with the public health community. We will also
complete an executive order restricting smoking in federal buildings for a signing event the
following week.
